General Databases

  • Ulrichs
    A bibliographic database providing detailed, comprehensive, and authoritative information on journals published throughout the world.
  • Google Scholar
    Google Scholar searches academic publishers, professional societies, pre-print archives, and university institutional repositories.
  • Academic Search Premier
    Multi-disciplinary database providing information for nearly every area of academic study
  • Web of Science
    Broad coverage science database. Includes analytical tools.
  • SocINDEX with Full Text
    Comprehensive sociology research database
  • LexisNexis Academic
    Full-text database that covers news, political, legal, and business
  • Ingenta ConnectComplete
    Searchable database of more than 12 million citations from over 26,000 journals
  • Scopus
    Abstract and citation database of peer-reviewed journals, books and conference proceedings

Encyclopedias & Dictionaries

  • Encyclopedia of Crime & Justice
    more... less...
    The encyclopedia of crime & justice not only discusses many different kinds of crime--from perjury to terrorism--but also looks at law enforcement, legal procedures and penalties and the social causes and wide-ranging impact of crimes on society. The articles reflect issues dominating the news and entertainment media--topics that are frequently discussed or assigned in both high school and college curricula. What is perjury? How do copyright laws pertain to the Internet? Can a juvenile be tried as an adult for murder? In 250 A-Z entries, these interdisciplinary articles deal with the sociology, psychology, history and economics of crime.
  • Encyclopedia of Crime and Punishment
    more... less...
    "Authoritative and comprehensive, this multivolume set includes hundreds of articles in the field of criminal justice. Impressive arrays of authors have contributed to this resource, addressing such diverse topics as racial profiling, money laundering, torture, prisoner literature, the KGB, and Sing Sing. Written in an accessible manner and attractively presented, the background discussions, definitions, and explanations of important issues and future trends are absorbing. Interesting sidebars and facts, reference lists, relevant court cases, tables, and black-and-white photographs supplement the entries. Appendixes cover careers in criminal justice, Web resources, and professional organizations. A lengthy bibliography lists relevant works."--"The Best of the Best Reference Sources," American Libraries, May 2003
  • Encyclopedia of Criminological Theory
    more... less...
    Provides a reference source for anyone interested in the roots of contemporary criminological theory. Examines the global landscape of all the key theories and the theorists behind them, presenting them in the context needed to understand their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Encyclopedia of Juvenile Justice
    more... less...
    From boot camps to truancy, this encyclopedia provides more than 200 up-to-date, concise and readable entries in a single volume.
  • Encyclopedia of Law Enforcement
    more... less...
    Examines all facets of law enforcement on the state and local, federal and national, and international stages. Includes discussions on the practice and theory of policing in an historical and contemporary framework.
  • Encyclopedia of Race and Crime
    more... less...
    The encyclopedia is designed to provide reference material and an introduction to historical and contemporary race and crime topics. It supports study, research, and instruction by presenting brief overviews and references to more in-depth presentations in other published sources.
  • Prentice Hall's dictionary of American criminal justice, criminology, and criminal law
